description: Least common multiple of integers less than and prime to n.
comments: If n is a prime power, tau(a(n)) is the number of times n occurs in A034699. (If n is not a prime power, it does not occur in A034699.) - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 01 2008a(n) = lcm(A038566(n,k): k = 1..A000010(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 21 2013
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..200
example: Since 1, 5, 7, and 11 are relatively prime to 12, a(12) = LCM(1,5,7,11) = 385.
mathematica: Table[ LCM@@ Flatten[ Position[ GCD[ n, # ]& /@ Range[ n ], 1 ] ], {n, 32} ]Join[{1},Table[LCM@@Select[Range[n-1],CoprimeQ[#,n]&],{n,2,40}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 05 2016 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = local(r); r=1;for(i=1,n-1,if(gcd(i,n)==1,r=lcm(r,i)));r - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 01 2008(Haskell)(Haskell)a038610 = foldl lcm 1 . a038566_row-- Reinhard Zumkeller, Sep 21 2013, Oct 04 2011
author: _Wouter Meeussen_
